intro: Tetrapetalum volubile, commonly known as the climbing tetrapetalum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial vine characterized by its twining stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Tetrapetalum volubile is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats.
